PATIENT_ID: TEST_PEN_NECK_001
ARRIVAL_TIME: 2026-02-02 16:00:00

[TRAUMA_HP] 2026-02-02 16:10:00
Category I activation for 29-year-old male with penetrating neck injury.
Stab wound to left anterior neck. Active hemorrhage from neck wound.
Expanding cervical hematoma noted on arrival.
BP 88/52, HR 130, RR 24, GCS 14.
Hemodynamic shock attributable to neck injury.
Airway intact but compromised due to expanding hematoma.

[NURSING_NOTE] 2026-02-02 16:15:00
Direct pressure applied to wound. Hemorrhage from neck controlled temporarily.
Vitals trending: BP 85/50, HR 134.

[PHYSICIAN_NOTE] 2026-02-02 16:25:00
Exam: platysma violated. Injury classified as zone II based on wound location.
Platysma integrity compromised. Zone classification confirmed.
Neurologic examination intact. No focal deficit.
Tracheal injury not identified on exam. Airway secure via OET.

[IMAGING] 2026-02-02 16:35:00
CT angiography neck obtained. CTA neck demonstrates vascular injury to
left internal jugular vein. No carotid artery injury identified.

[OPERATIVE_NOTE] 2026-02-02 17:00:00
Operative intervention for neck exploration and repair.
Taken to OR for surgical management of penetrating neck injury.
